snippet: An article Monday in The New York Times described how the problems at the root of the WebOS operating system led to the ultimate failure of the Hewlett-Packard TouchPad. People who worked on the project took to the Internet to comment on the article...
abstract: An article Monday in The New York Times described how the problems at the root of the WebOS operating system led to the ultimate failure of the Hewlett-Packard TouchPad. People who worked on the project took to the Internet to comment on the article and share their experiences.
lead_paragraph: In Monday's New York Times, Brian X. Chen reported on the story behind the failure of Hewlett-Packard's TouchPad tablet, which was pulled off the market after just seven weeks. The article cited former employees of both Palm, which made WebOS, the core software on the TouchPad, and Hewlett-Packard, which acquired Palm. They said the creation of WebOS was flawed, and ultimately led to the TouchPad's failure.

headline.main: Daily Report: What Went Wrong at Palm
